Team Directory                Roxanne Hori      Associate Dean, Corporate Relations and Career Services      rhori@stern.nyu.edu     (212) 998-0610              Beth Briggs      Senior Director, Office of Career Development      bbriggs@stern.nyu.edu     (212) 998-0973              Abigail Kies      Senior Director, Career Center for Working Professionals      akies@stern.nyu.edu     (212) 998-0854                           Career and Leadership Development Teams              Career Center for Working Professionals (CCWP)      Career Resources, Operations and Technology      Leadership Development      OCD Career Coaching Team for Full-Time MBA students      OCD Relationship Management Team                             Career Center for Working Professionals (CCWP )              The Career Center for Working Professionals (CCWP) is an office dedicated to NYU Stern's alumni and working professional students, providing them with lifelong career support through a range of services.          To learn more about the CCWP and it's services, Click Here .           ccwp@stern.nyu.edu     212-998-0235          44 West 4th Street     Suite 4-140     New York, NY 10012           Hours of Operation     Monday: 10am - 7pm     Tuesday: 10am - 7pm     Wednesday: 10am - 6pm     Thursday: 10am - 6pm     Friday: 9am - 5pm      Martha Patton     Associate Director      mpatton@stern.nyu.edu     (212) 998-0494           Beverley Caen     Associate Director      bcaen@stern.nyu.edu     (212) 998-0398           Tracy C. Full-Time MBA Students              The Office of Career Development (OCD) are committed to facilitating the student job search process by providing the best available resources and expertise to help enable career aspirations and employment goals, resulting in an optimal fit with organizations.           ocd@stern.nyu.edu     (212) 998-0623          44 West 4th Street     Suite 5-100     New York, NY 10012           Hours of Operation     Monday - Friday: 9am - 5pm           Semester Walk-In Open Hours     Monday-Thursday 12pm - 1pm              Mike Minutoli     Director      mminutol@stern.nyu.edu     (212) 998-0899              Tammy Simmons     Senior Associate Director      tsimmons@stern.nyu.edu     (212) 998-0992              James Kingham     International Career Counselor      alee2@stern.nyu.edu     (212) 998-0595             BACK TO TOP                    OCD Relationship Management Team              The Relationship Management Team is aligned by industry, each member responsible for and highly knowledgeable about companies within specific industries and business sectors. Our team makes it our business to understand the needs of Stern’s corporate partners so that our students and alumni are in the best possible position to fulfill them.           rmt@stern.nyu.edu     (212) 998-0623          44 West 4th Street     Suite 5-100     New York, NY 10012           Hours of Operation     Monday - Friday: 9am - 5pm          Find your Relationship Manager aligned by industry. The Wasserman Center is here to help make those first steps as easy as possible. There may be a lot to accomplish - let us help you take it one step at a time.                             Preparing for the Job Search:        Resumes, Cover Letters,          Interviewing & Networking                                         Find a Job or Internship:        NYU CareerNet,          On-Campus Employment & Recruitment                                         Career Fairs:        Make the Most          Out of Career Fairs                                              Eligible NYU Schools     The Wasserman Career Development Center is open to all New York University undergraduate and graduate degree candidates* and alumni from the Center for Urban Science and Progress · College of Arts and Science · College of Nursing · Gallatin School of Individualized Study · Global Public Health Program · Graduate School of Arts and Science · Liberal Studies · Polytechnic School of Engineering · Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service · School of Professional Studies (including Graduate Certificates) · Silver School of Social Work · Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development · Stern School of Business (Undergraduate only) · Tisch School of the Arts.     * Stern School of Business (Graduate) , School of Law , School of Medicine, and College of Dentistry students are eligible for assistance with alternative careers.          School-Specific Career Services Offices   Students from the following schools are encouraged to use the resources at the Wasserman Center and also at their school's career center.   » The Wasserman Center | School of Professional Studies     » Tisch School of the Arts   » Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service              Main Office        Office Hours     Monday & Friday  9am-5pm   Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday   9am - 7pm        Walk-in Hours     Monday : 2:30pm-4pm   Tuesday : 12pm-1:30pm & 2:30pm-4pm   Wednesday : 2:30pm-4pm & 5pm-6:30pm   Thursday : 2:30pm-4pm & 5pm-6:30pm   Friday : 12pm-1:30pm   Graduate Student Walk-in Hours*   Tuesdays: 5pm-6:30pm   Fridays: 2pm-3:30pm  *Graduate students may also visit walk-in hours during the hours listed above.               Brooklyn Office        Office Hours     Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday  9am-5pm   Wednesday  9am-7pm          Walk-in Hours     Monday: 2:30pm-4pm   Tuesday: 2:30pm-4pm   Wednesday: 5pm-6:30pm   Thursday: 2:30pm-4pm   Friday: 12pm-1:30pm               School of Professional Studies Office        Office Hours   Monday, Tuesday, Thursday  9am-7pm   Wednesday & Friday  9am-5pm          Walk-in Hours   Monday : 3pm-4:30pm   Tuesday : 12pm-1:30pm   Wednesday : 12pm-1:30pm   Thursday : 3pm-4:30pm   Friday : 12pm-1:30pm               Holiday Hours   The Wasserman Center for Career Development will be closed in accordance with the University holiday and recess schedule . Virtual Chat   Have your career questions answered in real time by chatting with a career coach online. To access the virtual career chat feature, log in to NYU CareerNet and click "Chat with a Career Coach". The Wasserman Center is here to help make those first steps as easy as possible. There may be a lot to accomplish - let us help you take it one step at a time.                             Preparing for the Job Search:        Resumes, Cover Letters,          Interviewing & Networking                                         Find a Job or Internship:        NYU CareerNet,          On-Campus Employment & Recruitment                                         Career Fairs:        Make the Most          Out of Career Fairs                                              Eligible NYU Schools     The Wasserman Career Development Center is open to all New York University undergraduate and graduate degree candidates* and alumni from the Center for Urban Science and Progress · College of Arts and Science · College of Nursing · Gallatin School of Individualized Study · Global Public Health Program · Graduate School of Arts and Science · Liberal Studies · Polytechnic School of Engineering · Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service · School of Professional Studies (including Graduate Certificates) · Silver School of Social Work · Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development · Stern School of Business (Undergraduate only) · Tisch School of the Arts.     * Stern School of Business (Graduate) , School of Law , School of Medicine, and College of Dentistry students are eligible for assistance with alternative careers.          School-Specific Career Services Offices   Students from the following schools are encouraged to use the resources at the Wasserman Center and also at their school's career center.   » The Wasserman Center | School of Professional Studies     » Tisch School of the Arts   » Robert F.            Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                                                Development Initiatives   The China Initiative is the first Development Initiative housed within the Center. Development initiatives supported by the Center for Global Economy and Business must demonstrate the presence of significant activity or professional interest at Stern in their area of study. A development initiative may support workshops or seminar series' that gain wide faculty participation.                                       Development Initiative Operations      Hosting of formal seminars and informal workshops    Community building, networking and information sharing, including web-based databases with bios, working papers, op-eds, blogs, events, and announcements    Research database development or acquisition    Programs that take advantage of and serve NYU's global sites                                                                Development Initiatives     China Initiative   Global Economy Course                           News      NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights to Tackle Migrant Labor Rights in the Construction Industry    Foreign Policy Association Awards Medal to Dean Peter Henry    Follow @NYUStern on Twitter and like NYU Stern on Facebook         Basics      Directions & Maps    Faculty Directory    Contact Us                                 FACULTY OPINIONS    Read Stern faculty opinions on  relevant business topics             Sitemap | Privacy | © 2015 Leonard N.
